title: Clique POA nodes stop syncing and try to connect to peers endlessly
body:
Using a forked version with some changes but I did not touch the syncing/discovery logic. 

I have 5 sealer nodes, 1 non-sealer node, and 3 bootnodes connected together. Previously (like a week or two ago), everything was working fine for about 2-3 months with no issues and was syncing as intended.

Just recently the sealer nodes stopped syncing and starting doing peer discovery. Have not been able to pin point the issue for this. I have not changed the go-ethereum code at all recently.

Now when I try to `admin.addPeer()` and connect to the `non-sealer node` it starts to sync for a short while then it stops and starts doing peer discovery with nodes that aren't mine.

#### System information
Geth version: `v1.8.18-stable-72eff4ee//go1.11.1`
OS & Version: `linux-amd64`
Commit hash : `58632d44021bf095b43a1bb2443e6e3690a94739`

#### Expected behaviour
Nodes sync together with no issues.

#### Actual behaviour
Nodes stop syncing and do endless peer discovery with other nodes that aren't mine. 

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour
Deploy 5 sealer nodes, 1 non-sealer node, and 3 bootnodes. Have them sync with each other. I am not completely sure if this is reproducible but I am just explaining my setup.

#### Backtrace
These are the logs where a sealer node fully syncs up to the non-sealer nodes current block number and then stops syncing and looking for peers.


What you're seeing is what happens when inbound peers discover your node and tries to sync, which fails early on in the handshake. 
I'm not sure why it lost connectivity with the peers it had initially though

The logs from the sealer above could happen if the sealer has contact with 1 of your peers, causing a successfull sync. Then it starts mining, but in order to progress it needs someone else to mine blocks on top -- otherwise it get's into a stall. So are all (at least enough) miners working?

@holiman Yes the problem has resolved. Can't remember the exact solution, but I believe I just defined the static nodes and now they sync up with no issues. I do have all 5 nodes up and running now. Will report again if it comes up again, but don't think it's an issue. Thanks.
